_header: Saint Brendan the holy man was here of our land
Subjects: saints’ lives; Brendan, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Brendan in the South English Legendary — 738 lines in couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Brendan þe holi mon was of IrlondeMonek he was of harde
                    lyue as ic vnderstonde…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…An albei þus was seþþe arered as is bodi was
                    idoNou god ous bringe to þulke Ioie as is soule wende to
BodAsh43.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Die altenglische Legende von St. Brendan aus Ms. Ashmole 43, fol.
                71b.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         53 (1874): 17-48: 17-37.
Bälz,  Martha. 
             Die Mittelenglische Brendanlegende des Gloucesterlegendars.
         Berlin: Mayer & Müller, 1909.

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint brandan þe holy monk was ȝond in erlondMonk he was
                    of hard lyf as ich ondirstond…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…An abbey þer is arered þat his body was In
                    doNouȝ god vs brynge to þylke Ioye as his soule wente
                    to

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint brendan þe holi man was here of ovre londeMonek he was
                    of harde liue as ich me under stonde…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…And a fair Abbeie þare is ared ase is bodi was idoGod
                    bringue us to þulke Ioye þat is soule wende to
BodLauMis108.Attributed Title: Vita sancti Brendani Abbatis de Hybernia (f. 104)
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 220-40.

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Brendan þe holy mon he was of IrlondMonke he was of
                    Ardee as ȝe shul vnderstonde…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…A fayre Abbay þere is bylde þere as his bones
                    lyneGod send vs all into þat ioye þere as his soule is ynne
                    Amen

LeedsRipon.Note:
Fragment, binding strip, with only beginnings of last nine
                    lines.

Wisbech.Transcription:
Þer ich was þis oþer dai þo ower broþer
                    þ[…]& was into þe py[ne] i ladde & wel sone
                    ha[…]……Seint Brendan sede inis [name] ich hote
                    o[…]Þat ȝe ne touche hym [noȝt toniȝt] arto
                    m[…]
Wisbech.Note:
Two binding strips (fragments) now pieced together to form a single
                    leaf; damaged by damp and cut off at edges; correspond to lines 538-590, 594-645
                    of D’Evelyn  and  Mill (1959)
XCharlotte D’Evelyn,   and  A. J. Mill.

                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
